Posted: April 17, 2016
												The biggest complaint is that there are no people in the game and this is somewhat true there are considerably less people than other MMOs but the game is very fun it is a lot like runescape. I actually think that the lack of players works out in everyones favor. See in WOW the servers are very crowded and from a purely social standpoint it is very easy to get lost in the crowd. Here if you try you can make friends I mean there are some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s but there are also a lot of great players. I find it easy to approach sommeone alone by a dungeon and ask if you would like to do it together. There are also only six classes to choose from so a player can get comfortable with each class and the strategy used to play it which is hard to do. It also can be difficult for some people to get used to communicating online and in MMOs and feel this game is great for that. I enjoy the game and hope the developers update it to increase the interest in new players. It is free to play so there is no cost which is good. They also have seasonal events which are quite enjoyable. I guess every MMO has its problems but It has decent multiplayer interface and I lot of quests. The dugeons are fun to go through if you have a good team of people. Again it is basically like runescape so if you like runescape you will like this game. The developers will hopefully continue to update the game and create tasks to keep players involved and hopefully one day they will have enough people to run PVP events. I personally found no trouble to find people to do dugeons with and if you need someone I would definitely go with you.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												I will start off with this game has potential but is still by far what I would call a complete game. Story, skill trees, and professions are well designed and has many potentials to be free from the standard playing style where u are fixed to your own class. However there are a few major shortcoming. Story-wise, the quests brings you throught the story quite nicely and smoothly however I would disagree on the breaking up of the major quests to multiple smaller quests and you can only advance when u reach a particular level. This make me feel like the story like always left hanging after a quest completion and there are a few major quests with all different sequence. This really breaks the storytelling part of the game.Skill trees is up for a praise. Freedom to be whatever you want and not restricted by class is one I really like. Feels more fun when you can have a Battle Mage instead of just a mage. It opens up to numerous possiblities of character customization.Professions well its fun if you need a sidetrack from the battle. What I like about the professions is that you are not restricted and you can level whichever profession you like provided you are willing to burn those hours in. What I don't like about professions are the professions' equipments. There is basically no way to upgrade your professions' equipment. It feels static as in you are just a bot mining / fishing / farming / etc. There is no sense of achievement.Overall, like I mentioned, it is a game with potentials but at this moment, it is still far from a complete game. Maybe give it a year or 2 and it will be worthwhile to play.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												Thus far a pretty decent MMORPG. The control take a bit of getting used to, but I think that's more the fault of the player than the game itself. The quests range from combat-oriented to simple run-around-and-pick-stuff-up quests that can tip you over the experience edge when you don't feel like killing another dozen or so Shigra in the early stages. Crafting is proving to be a fun diversion, too, with options ranging from cooking to alchemy to weaponsmithing. The standard crafts, basically, but that doesn't make them any less amusing to do.My only complaint is that while there's much of the game you can accomplish solo (which is nice for me, since I love the MMO style but am not so keen on random interaction with strangers), there are quests that can't be cleared without a party. And since there are so few players of the game, you can someone be waiting the better part of an hour for someone to jump in the quest queue so you can clear out a dungeon that's "too hard" to do alone. (Seriously, when the dungeon level is 5 and I'm level 10, I can do it myself. Really. Just watch me!) You can, to the game's credit, keep doing other things while you wait for a party to be gathered, but it's still frustrating to be forced into group situations when you don't really have to be.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2016
												I have been looking for an alternative to RuneScape for 3 years.Having gotten sick and tired of their membership system I started looking for an mmo that DOESN'T require a monthly sub for all the content.First I looked at LoTR Online, it was ok, but didn't really have the RS vibe.And after ALMOST buying the Elder Scrolls Online I found Eldevin. And it was exactly what I was looking for.I have been very impressed so far, it looks very well done and it really gives me nostalgic flashbacks, Eldevin is even made in Java for crying out loud like RS was!Then my heart broke when I discovered that the devs weren't paying as much attention to this game, instead focusing on other projects. It meant that this game could go under anytime.But don't let that stop you. This game spells RuneScape clone only better all over. Play it, you won't be disappointed. Plus, you playing also keeps this game alive. So do it people, if you're after an MMO this could be it. People complain about the  lack of people, but the more people decide to give it a chance the more players there'll be. Please. Play it. You (Probably) won't be disappointed.EDIT: They just updated the game this week. Unfortunately the update unbalanced the game regard XP and gathering skills. So I would hold off playing it for now (good time for me to take a break) but I appreciate that the devs still care.They patched it again, and the new gathering skill levels look a bit better at least for players starting out. So go ahead and give this game a try.

content:
Posted: February 28
												The player base is very small compared to what it used to be but it is okay because there are still Guilds you can join that are active. Since the player base is small, it is quality instead of quantity. Everyone helps each other out unless you find that one guy who just downloaded the game so he can spend 12 hours straight standing still asking people for low level gear that he could have made himself through ten minutes of mining and crafting. (Yes, that happened.)They added Mailboxes but they aren't useful since they charge quite the fee to use them. But you won't use them anyway since it isn't that much of a hassle to trade.The dungeon designs are pretty unique and the dialogue is good. The only thing I disliked was that you were forced to go through with the tutorial and that you needed to complete a small chain quest to use the bank. The gameplay isn't complicated so i'm not sure why the tutorial was required but maybe it was just to be safe incase the community ended up being kids trying to act old school.The community is mainly adults. I saw a few of the top (though negative) reviews saying the community was kids but that just isn't true. Maybe in 2013 there were a lot of kids playing it but they quit pretty quickly since they didn't have the patience to quest and grind.This game was made by a small indie developer over 8 years and I think they did pretty well. They intentionally went for the Runescape themed MMORPG. For those who are saying "You might as well play WoW." Well that is $15 a month and isn't what it used to be. For those who say "You might as well play Runescape." Well Runescape also isn't what it used to be. Eldevin is a great game to get the nostalgia feeling of an MMO.

												Let me start off by saying this game is not for everyone. Just like RuneScape - this type of graphics, gameplay and controller is probably disliked by those who like AAA quality games.Personally I find this game really fun and really immersive. I usually get bored of all MMO games within hours because all they contain is shipping the player around the map and end game content. Not Eldevin.Upon minutes of entering the game and walking through the tutorial, I got lost in the map with no consequences. I ended up in a city where I got adopted into a homeless gang through a subquest which escalated to helping cleanse a city from plague and assasinating a poor old man for no reason what so ever. The extreme amount of quests and the game not punishing the player for wandering around the map and picking up random quests is what makes this game amazing.I definitely reccomend it!

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Other reviewers have provided solid reasons to like or dislike ths game, however a few small things through a small amount of play have me intrigued.A bit of cleverness and curveball in some of the quests. You can tell that writing and story are important to the devs, and as such you're rewarded better than the usual outing. Its no TSW, but certainly a far better focus on story than most.Open-skill, classless system of advancement. While the levels still tick up traditionally, there are no hard-and-fast rules on who can do what. Personalization is fantastic.Lots of crafting and lots of evidence that ideas like progress and advancement have been re-thought in certain interesting ways.The biggest issue I have is the click-to-move. It kills me.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												Are you an older gamer?Do you remember the classic MMO's like Everquest?Or perhaps you are just a fan of the older games that was more about Gameplay then pretty graphics...Eldevin is one of these types of games, it is a free to play MMO that got its start as a browser game but it is now run on its own engine since coming to steam and is quite fun to play...I will talk about what I have seen so far. The launcher is simple and works but does need more work as sometimes it can become buggy, Character creation is pretty simple too but it works, remember this game is NOT about prettty graphics but instead "Gameplay"!There are a great many of quests to do and some of the story related ones can be quite interesting if you take the time to read them, there are also plenty of side quests that some will skip through to ease the grinding... About the grind, there is a lot of it and most is good if you approach it the correct way such as the crafting system, it is bery robust and lots of depth. You can do prospecting, fishing, cooking, weaponsmithing and armorsmithing and severl more. The way it works is that each time you do something like mining ore it levels up, and so far I have come to see that you can make some really nice gear that you can sell to other players for a decent price.There is plenty of things you can do solo if that is your style, but there is also a pretty nice community of veteran players who will be happy to help you out if you ever want to group up and do some of the cool dungeon quests, some of them can get you some nice rewards such as gear and relics.Overall I would have to say that this is a decent MMO that will only get better as they keep working on it, as it is now there is tons of content to play with and just might find yourself addicted to it :-)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												Coming from someone who played oldschool runescape, early WoW and almost every other F2P MMO out there to date..I really enjoy this game. 1. You are completely free to do whatever you want, whenever you want ( just like runescape )2. Many professions, items scaled for each profession as you gain levels in it3. The class tree is basically like Runescape, but better.. and here's why  - You start the game, and during the tutorial you're taught basic MEELE, MAGIC, RANGE skills      then from there on out, you level and spend attributes to whatever you want to increase in     There are talent trees aswell, about 7 of them but you're free to mix them up, ( half points into assasin, and/or mage )     Very free to build yourself the way you want ( Like Skyrim )4. Player base is huge, friendly community, since i've started i've been asked if I wanted help several times from       higher level players.5. Eldevin has been quoted that even though you can pay to gain advantages ( xp boost, profession xp boost )    EVERY ZONE IN THE GAME IS FREE TO EXPLORE for FREE or PAID players and it's staying that way.    This is NOT a P2W game.6. There is PVP, group dungions, solo dungions, great replay value, and grinding is funNow those are just some of the great things in Eldevin.. Here's what will drive some people off right away..1. Bad graphics ( for the average mmo out today ) BUT That goes without saying, it's gameplay is much better than almost every other MMO out today. If you liked Runescape and that playstyle you WILL love this game.2.WASD is in motion, yes you can click on the map to go somewhere, or even right infront of you just like runescape,    Although WASD is much more comfortable to use, it is a bit clunky and should be refined abit more.Hope I helped someone make a decision. I don't normally do reviews ( maybe 1 before this ) but I used to look at games thinking oh that looks good, then read 1 bad review and never look at it again.. well I suggest you try it out for yourself, I did and I do not regret it at all, I'll be playing this for a long time.. If you decide to join, add me as a friend *Koz*

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												After 8 hours, I review.First of all, DO NOT JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER. This game has an engaging, imaginative storyline, a class-less combat system, a whole mess of crafting, all in a very large world.The graphics...are terrible. I'll say that right now. But graphics shouldn't matter for a gem like this. If you liked OLD runescape, when it was good, play this. If you want nostalgia, play this game.There are a few bugs, mainly around using WASD to move making your toon move at a crawl or suddenly switch directions or teleport a bit, but I've quickly gotten used to a diablo-style playstyle instead of a rift or SWtOR kind. (FIXED!)All in all:Gameplay-8.5/10Story/lore-9/10Combat-9/10graphics-5/10nostalgia-10/10OVERALL-9.5/10, VERY good, I definitely recommend this to just about anyone.

Posted: November 28, 2016
												This game is a neat little gem on steam. I've played this game ever since it came out on Steam and I have to say, even though the playerbase is small, the graphics are a bit outdated and even though I have taken multiple long breaks from this game.....it just always seems to bring me back to it and I enjoy it every time it does. All I have to say is:  don't let the small playerbase scare you away from this game. The community is nice and helpful, heck if you join a guild, you'll form a friendship with other people and it'll feel less lonely and you'll quickly forget how small the playerbase can be.I will give a word of warning though, avoid Trapper's Atol unless you plan to do pvp, there are many players complaining about getting killed at this place despite it being a pvp island. It's a small part of the game so avoiding it wouldn't affect your experience of Eldevin in any wayGive this game a try, after all it's free and the ony thing you lose by playing is the time you used to playing this. I won't guarantee you will like this game, after all everyone has their own preferences, but I do highly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												This game is fun and highly enjoyable. If you judge on graphics, you're really only just scratching the surface. For a free MMO (well, mainly free, there is certainly an P2W aspect in here but it's mainly ignorable) this game has a lot of content and a lot of things to sink your time into, especially with a few friends. With a huge skill tree system and no locking into classes, the amount of customisation available to you from the offset it vast and interesting. Although the basic roles offered in most MMOs are also present here - Damage, Tank and Healer - there are other ways to really customise your character and class as much as you would ever want to. There are lots of things to do on the map, such as dungeons, and the professions system is quite in-depth and enjoyable. While there is a lot of grinding, the grinding in this game is among the most enjoyable I have ever had. Overall I would give this game about an 8/10 so far

content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
												Played for an hour and some change. Combine some features from this game and RuneScape and you'd have a pretty intriguing RPG. It was very attention grabbing, the combat was way more entertaining than that of Runescape. That being said the two games are similar feeling. Overall, it was a fun play (for about an hour), but sadly its population is nearly dead and "running on fumes", it has potential, but there are way better funded and more populated mmorpg games out there. Still it's worth at least a try and can kill some time. The graphics are dated even compared to ruinscape. For me the very low population is what kills it. If you're looking for a fun rpg to pass time and aren't really serious about pvp or playing with large scales of people,  or even seening a bunch of people in game, then this game would be perfect for you. If the population would pick up this could be a long term dive. Features a classless system, with attribute points and talent trees which boost certain skills power and gives you unique to tree passives. Also an in-game cash shop featuring items such as exp boosters and cosmetics. Unlike Runescape, this game does have mounts. Also various crafting and gathering skills.

content:
Posted: January 31
												I had 25 hours in this game on my old account and have just started playing again. It is a great runescape-esque mmo with tons of quests and tons of skills to level.It is fun to run around, trade with players, and find people to raid harder dungeons with. The only issue is that this game has virtually no playerbase.My first day back I met someone who crafted me some gear and ran around with me for a bit, but after that there was nothing. With less than 100 people playing a day it isn't as good of an experience as it could be. If this game was revamped and could gain a surge in players, then it would be a great time.As of now I've been enjoying leveling skills and completing quests by myself and with the few players that do play, but will probably stop playing soon (again). Overall a fun game if you enjoy some aspects of runescape, but with more easy to handle mechanics. A lack of players makes it undesirable as an mmo to play these days though, which leads to a downwards spiral of even less players.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												HUGE EDIT Okay I've played this game a bit more, learned about it & I've decided to change my rating because of this one fatal flaw that completely ruins the game. YOU HAVE TO PAY TO RESPEC or wait 2 months!  Yes, that one little but HUGE flaw is making me not want to bother playing this game anymore.  Any game that emphasizes class customization makes you WANT to try out all the different specs that you can & this is just plain exploitation of their own system to FORCE you to pay money to try different things & for that I am saying NO.If the game ever gets rid of this pure exploitive tactic then I may come back, until then I'm staying away.REVIEWNow before I start my review let me just say that a lot of people are comparing this game to Runescape & saying it's just a clone.  While this game & Runescape have a few things in common they are both completly different as a whole.  Now, with that said let's get on with the review.GRAPHICSLet me begin with the games graphics since it will be the first thing you see about the game.  The graphics aren't anything amazing or ground breaking but they do have their own unique feel.  It resembles oldschool RPG's like Morrowind & Neverwinter while pulling off it's own look in between.  There are some things I wish the game had graphics wise, however.  The game does have a day/night cycle but this feels like it's simply achieved by a slight contrast change.  Half the time you won't know if it's night or day unless you use the /time command which will bring up the current in game time.  Another thing I wish this game had would be a sun or a moon.  If you choose to bring the games camera down to OTS level you will notice the sky is bland & lifeless.  There is also no real time shading in the game.Just because the graphics aren't great doesn't mean this game doesn't look good because it does.  It also feels alive in the scenery that you will see change depending on the time of day.  Some civilian NPC's have their own schedule & at evening to late night hours you will see the taverns start filling up with people.  They will even start having their own conversations while doing their daily activities that you can eavesdrop on.  The ones I've seen so far have been guards talking while on patrol & drunken men flirting with barmaidens.  This small feature alone brings out a lot more life to the game. GAMEPLAYThe game can be played in 2 different ways.  Point & Click or WASD style.  So, if you prefer the top down camera point & click style ARPG you can play it that way.  If you prefer the OTS camera & walking with WASD you can do that as well.  You can seemlessly move between the 2 styles.  All & all it feels good & responsive.  The animations in the game are lacking, however.  They are simple, smooth & get the job done.  They aren't flashy like most MMO's are doing nowadays..  You won't see any moves that involve jumping around while attacking but you will see your character go into a solid stance.  When you attack it feels a little too quick.  Melee animations consist of quick swipes or jabs sometimes several per second that make it seem like your character is on speed or had too many energy drinks.   I do like the emotes a lot, though.  If you get your character drunk he will stumble around or vomit on himself.  It's pretty funny & probably worth playing the game to see that emote alone.My only real complaint is no matter how much I push spacebar it never jumps.  :'(CRAFTINGThis game has a ton of crafting.  If you like games where you can spend hours upon hours of just crafting then you will probably enjoy this game.  I myself have already spent the majority of my game time doing nothing but crafting.  The best part is you can master all the crafts the game has to offer, so you will be busy for a while.The game has weapon & armor smithing, cooking, leatherwork, jewelcraft, alchemy, tailoring, etc.  Every craft has it's own gathering profession. All of which are available to master.CLASSESThis game utilizes a custom class system.  In short, you are what you want to be.  And I don't mean you are what you want within the games limits.  You are what you really want.  If you want to be a Battlemage in heavy plate you can do that.  If you want to be an archer with a big 2h weapon you can do that too.  This game's class system is possibly one of the coolest in any MMO I've played.You earn points each level & you can put those points into Health, Mana, Melee, Range, Magic, & Crit/Accuraccy,  It's very easy to build a pure style or hybrid class.  If you plan on trying to do all 3 rolls you may have a harder time.  All equipment also increases these stats varying depending on what type of equipment you use.  There are also 6 Talent Trees.  Templar(Shield), Warrior (2H), Assassin (Dual Wield), Ranger, Mage & Prophet (Heals).  These trees each specialize in a specific weapon or spell type & gives passive/active abilities depending on which weapon/armor/spells you plan on using. The best part about this game's class system is how you go about learning spells/abilities.  You simply buy a scroll from a trainer & learn it.  You keep the ability you purchase forever as well.  Respecs are just for points & talents.  The more powerful spells for each class are in the talent trees which you have to unlock by putting in points.  OVERALLIt's got a great oldschool vibe with a mix of modern day elements & manages to also do some things other games haven't done before.  If you're aching for an old school RPG or MMO experience without the subscription then you should check this one out.  I would recommend downloading the game client outside of STEAM, though.  I was having some wierd bugs running the steam version & all of that went away when I used the install from their official website.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												HUGE EDIT Okay I've played this game a bit more, learned about it & I've decided to change my rating because of this one fatal flaw that completely ruins the game. YOU HAVE TO PAY TO RESPEC or wait 2 months!  Yes, that one little but HUGE flaw is making me not want to bother playing this game anymore.  Any game that emphasizes class customization makes you WANT to try out all the different specs that you can & this is just plain exploitation of their own system to FORCE you to pay money to try different things & for that I am saying NO.If the game ever gets rid of this pure exploitive tactic then I may come back, until then I'm staying away.REVIEWNow before I start my review let me just say that a lot of people are comparing this game to Runescape & saying it's just a clone.  While this game & Runescape have a few things in common they are both completly different as a whole.  Now, with that said let's get on with the review.GRAPHICSLet me begin with the games graphics since it will be the first thing you see about the game.  The graphics aren't anything amazing or ground breaking but they do have their own unique feel.  It resembles oldschool RPG's like Morrowind & Neverwinter while pulling off it's own look in between.  There are some things I wish the game had graphics wise, however.  The game does have a day/night cycle but this feels like it's simply achieved by a slight contrast change.  Half the time you won't know if it's night or day unless you use the /time command which will bring up the current in game time.  Another thing I wish this game had would be a sun or a moon.  If you choose to bring the games camera down to OTS level you will notice the sky is bland & lifeless.  There is also no real time shading in the game.Just because the graphics aren't great doesn't mean this game doesn't look good because it does.  It also feels alive in the scenery that you will see change depending on the time of day.  Some civilian NPC's have their own schedule & at evening to late night hours you will see the taverns start filling up with people.  They will even start having their own conversations while doing their daily activities that you can eavesdrop on.  The ones I've seen so far have been guards talking while on patrol & drunken men flirting with barmaidens.  This small feature alone brings out a lot more life to the game. GAMEPLAYThe game can be played in 2 different ways.  Point & Click or WASD style.  So, if you prefer the top down camera point & click style ARPG you can play it that way.  If you prefer the OTS camera & walking with WASD you can do that as well.  You can seemlessly move between the 2 styles.  All & all it feels good & responsive.  The animations in the game are lacking, however.  They are simple, smooth & get the job done.  They aren't flashy like most MMO's are doing nowadays..  You won't see any moves that involve jumping around while attacking but you will see your character go into a solid stance.  When you attack it feels a little too quick.  Melee animations consist of quick swipes or jabs sometimes several per second that make it seem like your character is on speed or had too many energy drinks.   I do like the emotes a lot, though.  If you get your character drunk he will stumble around or vomit on himself.  It's pretty funny & probably worth playing the game to see that emote alone.My only real complaint is no matter how much I push spacebar it never jumps.  :'(CRAFTINGThis game has a ton of crafting.  If you like games where you can spend hours upon hours of just crafting then you will probably enjoy this game.  I myself have already spent the majority of my game time doing nothing but crafting.  The best part is you can master all the crafts the game has to offer, so you will be busy for a while.The game has weapon & armor smithing, cooking, leatherwork, jewelcraft, alchemy, tailoring, etc.  Every craft has it's own gathering profession. All of which are available to master.CLASSESThis game utilizes a custom class system.  In short, you are what you want to be.  And I don't mean you are what you want within the games limits.  You are what you really want.  If you want to be a Battlemage in heavy plate you can do that.  If you want to be an archer with a big 2h weapon you can do that too.  This game's class system is possibly one of the coolest in any MMO I've played.You earn points each level & you can put those points into Health, Mana, Melee, Range, Magic, & Crit/Accuraccy,  It's very easy to build a pure style or hybrid class.  If you plan on trying to do all 3 rolls you may have a harder time.  All equipment also increases these stats varying depending on what type of equipment you use.  There are also 6 Talent Trees.  Templar(Shield), Warrior (2H), Assassin (Dual Wield), Ranger, Mage & Prophet (Heals).  These trees each specialize in a specific weapon or spell type & gives passive/active abilities depending on which weapon/armor/spells you plan on using. The best part about this game's class system is how you go about learning spells/abilities.  You simply buy a scroll from a trainer & learn it.  You keep the ability you purchase forever as well.  Respecs are just for points & talents.  The more powerful spells for each class are in the talent trees which you have to unlock by putting in points.  OVERALLIt's got a great oldschool vibe with a mix of modern day elements & manages to also do some things other games haven't done before.  If you're aching for an old school RPG or MMO experience without the subscription then you should check this one out.  I would recommend downloading the game client outside of STEAM, though.  I was having some wierd bugs running the steam version & all of that went away when I used the install from their official website.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												50 hours in-game:Eldevin is a addictive, slow-paced and story-driven MMORPG that is similar to Runescape 2 in many aspects.You have a freedom of choice when it comes to using your talent points and building your character - You can pick any role and switch later on. When starting out, you are given a bunch of quests - In fact, more than you need to level up. Quests require a lot of travel and in order to do quests you need to have combat stats. It doesn't take long to level combat, but if you just keep doing combat you miss out on various loot and skilling (profession) opportunities - there being 14 different professions.Professions can be tedious to level up because of slow animations (that you have to wait for), having too little inventory space, requiring a lot of travel and the materials costing too much at least early on. The sell price for most items is too low; you are constantly low on cash if you decide to use the materials you find for training professions. Only quests seem to reward a good amount of money at least at lower levels.Crafting professions can require 2-4x more effort to level up than a gathering profession. What I mean by this is that you'll reach the max prospecting level 3 or 4 times in the time you max Jewelry, Armorsmithing and Weaponsmithing. I think this is rather stupid - it's just a time consuming grind to get to higher levels of each crafting profession for almost no benefit.Even at higher levels, the time it takes to get to a level that matches your combat is better spent elsewhere. Instead of spending 10 hours to level 5 crafting levels, you could spend 10 hours questing and get 5 combat levels. Why should you do questing then? Because even if you get one crafting profession to your combat level, you'll only get that profession's specific equipment pieces; for example, a crafted heavy armor helmet to complete the set you just got from a dungeon, leaving rings/amulet/charm and weapons to be made with Jewelry and Weaponsmithing respectively. So yes, in short, the crafting professions feel useless and too tedious to level up.Getting so little money from enemies and items early on creates problems because you need money for repair and training a profession. For example, from a level 10 quest you get 2 silver - it costs 2 silver to buy 4 butter (buy from npc) to go with your 8 ham (skinning/loot) and 4 garlic (farming) that you need to make 4 cooked hams at level 8 cooking. Yes, that's 2 silver or 1 quest to make 4 items.There are a LOT of fetch quests with way too much travel; some are literally "go talk to north, go talk to south, talk to northeast, talk to southwest..then visit these locations, but first go to the beach and then check out the very end of a dungeon" type quests. The quests are all over the place (which can be nice, but not when most of them make you travel back and forth so much).. There also needs to be more item rewards in quests - The only weapons you get from quests (or anywhere else) at level 5-10 are either: one level 5 rare (boss or quest), level 6-10 uncommon (crafted) and level 10 legendary for legendary quest and then again you don't get any other good weapons until level 15. Crafted items are useless here too because they are all uncommon up to level 10 or at least worse than your weapons found from quests.The game is good otherwise, but indeed could use some improvements. I really like the soundtrack though, it's great. The graphics are good for a MMO of this type, but the game has some bugs. Your cursor can go crazy at random intervals because the game process starts to use more resources, your camera can start to spin in certain places and make it hard to turn it.The controls are great, being able to either click or move with WASD like in WoW, but it'd be nice if your character tried to get to the given location. Sometimes when you click, for example to move inside a tent through a narrow door, the character goes back and forth. If you move straight towards a small object, your character doesn't try to avoid it either.. I'd think it'd be nice if it did.The in-game mounts don't really feel like mounts with the small 20% speed increase at early levels and 60% at later levels. A small buff would be nice.add later:again a lot of travel from all of thisequipment taking a lot of space if you want to save some of it as a outfit for later - no huge equipment bags (like vanity)there is no auction house and no place for tradingactions take long to doenemies out of range even if in rangeevents for veterans missable by newer playersbecause quest starting points are all over the place and some quests are for the same area, its not uncommon to see higher levels in low level zones still completing some questsbecause of the reasons mentioned above, quests should be shown further to you on the map.soundtrack is awesome, but cannot be found anywhere.5 loyalty points per login for f2p - full loyalty set = 9000 pointsthere are some p2w items; subscription literally gives you extra exp, prestige, profession exp, removes gold cap (WTF literally)even vital skills such as skinning can get behind in your combat level because of so many quests at certain levels and not having enough space for quest items/skinning. this means you have to go back to lower level monsters and just kill them for skinning exp so you can continue questing with the ability to skin your level monsters.skill quests: for example level 16 giving tasks to get level 1 or level 8 gathering prof. items; can be annoying.abilities not powerful, animations take long which makes them very ineffective.certain abilities are broken and some descriptions are a bit off.at least the templar talent tree doesn't feel very optimizedno third skill bar for alt/ctrl/shift + normal keybinds even though there are a lot of skillslevel balance seems to be a bit off. lets say you barely solo a LV10 dungeon in story mode at level 11, then return after getting a new piece of epic boss dropped gear - you'll be able to do it without much worries.most boss fights can't be tanked, but have to be taunt-kited instead; really need some work here...need aoe marks on floor and clear indicators of what the bosses are going to do (this one boss on "dungeon" difficulty does 60% of a tanks hp on one melee swing and there aren't many healers playing the game (and if there were, they wouldn't heal much). this is extremely frustrating when paired with the movement / combat system of eldevinthere is an achievement for killing 100 000 players in the wilderness and another one for winning 2000 battlegrounds.this is just pathetic because no one will get those legitly; they just take too long. As a comparison, I, still at rank 20 rogue on my realm in WoW ( even though i haven't played for a year), I had 44025 honorable battleground kills and played 1438 battlegrounds.you have three options1) quest and only level combat, do not pick up profession items - your inventory won't be full at all2) quest, level combat and pick up profession items - your inventory will be very full quickly because two  4-9 slot bags aren't really helpful3) pay 10ecash and get a 64 slot bag a long with other goodies and have no trouble questing, leveling combat and training professions.why can't f2p system be more in between option 1 and 2? Legendaries take too much space for f2ps. whats a legendary item when it has to be sold to npc for 10 silver because you don't have 2 to 6 space for it?target out of range even if close issueinsane respawns at certain locations means you cant melee the monsters or you get overwhelmedI'll edit this later...

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												*My play time is rather short as shown on Steam, but I have put about 300 hours into the game before writing this review. I'm no elite top-level player, but I have put enough into the game to have some opinions about it.Ok, on with the review...Eldevin is a fantasy MMORPG that does a lot of really good things, but these things aren't particularly new to the genre. And that's not necessarily a bad thing IMO.Many compare it to other games like Runescape, and that is completely understandable. However, once you start playing, you will see some stark differences. It's approach to the genre is more of a themeparky style with PvE raids and traditional PvP game modes. Grab some loot from these instances and you'll then see the game's emphasis on a wide crafting system in which you make some nice gear. You have lots of quests to do, many of which are fetch-quests, but there are some nice cutscenes that propel the story forward. As either a sword-n-board tank, ranger, healer, warrior, mage, or hybrid build, you'll definitely have some quests to do. I must also say that this game is pretty on the eyes. Yes, others may not be too impressed about this game's graphical fidelity, but the overal *aesthetic* is very nice. Eldevin used to have an isometric view like Diablo, but the devs worked hard to make it 3D since many of the players wanted to see changes. The devs are pretty committed to seeing this game thrive, as they are active on the forums. The community is nice too both ingame and on the official forums. In all, Eldevin does not introduce new ideas, cutting-edge mechanics, or innovative gameplay, but it does what it does very well. Based off of this, you might think "Well, why should I play this, then?" If you are looking for a themepark MMO that changes everything and flips the genre upside-down, then Eldevin is *NOT* the game for you. On the other hand, if you are searching for a solid title with grindy-yet-satisfying crafting, good combat with nice build variety, beautiful aesthetics, and on-point gameplay, this is the game for you. All it needs is more content to truly become a premier free-to-play MMO. I'll give it a 7.5/10.

Legendaries take too much space for f2ps. whats a legendary item when it has to be sold to npc for 10 silver because you don't have 2 to 6 space for it?target out of range even if close issueinsane respawns at certain locations means you cant melee the monsters or you get overwhelmedI'll edit this later...

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												*My play time is rather short as shown on Steam, but I have put about 300 hours into the game before writing this review. I'm no elite top-level player, but I have put enough into the game to have some opinions about it.Ok, on with the review...Eldevin is a fantasy MMORPG that does a lot of really good things, but these things aren't particularly new to the genre. And that's not necessarily a bad thing IMO.Many compare it to other games like Runescape, and that is completely understandable. However, once you start playing, you will see some stark differences. It's approach to the genre is more of a themeparky style with PvE raids and traditional PvP game modes. Grab some loot from these instances and you'll then see the game's emphasis on a wide crafting system in which you make some nice gear. You have lots of quests to do, many of which are fetch-quests, but there are some nice cutscenes that propel the story forward. As either a sword-n-board tank, ranger, healer, warrior, mage, or hybrid build, you'll definitely have some quests to do. I must also say that this game is pretty on the eyes. Yes, others may not be too impressed about this game's graphical fidelity, but the overal *aesthetic* is very nice. Eldevin used to have an isometric view like Diablo, but the devs worked hard to make it 3D since many of the players wanted to see changes. The devs are pretty committed to seeing this game thrive, as they are active on the forums. The community is nice too both ingame and on the official forums. In all, Eldevin does not introduce new ideas, cutting-edge mechanics, or innovative gameplay, but it does what it does very well. Based off of this, you might think "Well, why should I play this, then?" If you are looking for a themepark MMO that changes everything and flips the genre upside-down, then Eldevin is *NOT* the game for you. On the other hand, if you are searching for a solid title with grindy-yet-satisfying crafting, good combat with nice build variety, beautiful aesthetics, and on-point gameplay, this is the game for you. All it needs is more content to truly become a premier free-to-play MMO. I'll give it a 7.5/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												HUGE EDIT Okay I've played this game a bit more, learned about it & I've decided to change my rating because of this one fatal flaw that completely ruins the game. YOU HAVE TO PAY TO RESPEC or wait 2 months!  Yes, that one little but HUGE flaw is making me not want to bother playing this game anymore.  Any game that emphasizes class customization makes you WANT to try out all the different specs that you can & this is just plain exploitation of their own system to FORCE you to pay money to try different things & for that I am saying NO.If the game ever gets rid of this pure exploitive tactic then I may come back, until then I'm staying away.REVIEWNow before I start my review let me just say that a lot of people are comparing this game to Runescape & saying it's just a clone.  While this game & Runescape have a few things in common they are both completly different as a whole.  Now, with that said let's get on with the review.GRAPHICSLet me begin with the games graphics since it will be the first thing you see about the game.  The graphics aren't anything amazing or ground breaking but they do have their own unique feel.  It resembles oldschool RPG's like Morrowind & Neverwinter while pulling off it's own look in between.  There are some things I wish the game had graphics wise, however.  The game does have a day/night cycle but this feels like it's simply achieved by a slight contrast change.  Half the time you won't know if it's night or day unless you use the /time command which will bring up the current in game time.  Another thing I wish this game had would be a sun or a moon.  If you choose to bring the games camera down to OTS level you will notice the sky is bland & lifeless.  There is also no real time shading in the game.Just because the graphics aren't great doesn't mean this game doesn't look good because it does.  It also feels alive in the scenery that you will see change depending on the time of day.  Some civilian NPC's have their own schedule & at evening to late night hours you will see the taverns start filling up with people.  They will even start having their own conversations while doing their daily activities that you can eavesdrop on.  The ones I've seen so far have been guards talking while on patrol & drunken men flirting with barmaidens.  This small feature alone brings out a lot more life to the game. GAMEPLAYThe game can be played in 2 different ways.  Point & Click or WASD style.  So, if you prefer the top down camera point & click style ARPG you can play it that way.  If you prefer the OTS camera & walking with WASD you can do that as well.  You can seemlessly move between the 2 styles.  All & all it feels good & responsive.  The animations in the game are lacking, however.  They are simple, smooth & get the job done.  They aren't flashy like most MMO's are doing nowadays..  You won't see any moves that involve jumping around while attacking but you will see your character go into a solid stance.  When you attack it feels a little too quick.  Melee animations consist of quick swipes or jabs sometimes several per second that make it seem like your character is on speed or had too many energy drinks.   I do like the emotes a lot, though.  If you get your character drunk he will stumble around or vomit on himself.  It's pretty funny & probably worth playing the game to see that emote alone.My only real complaint is no matter how much I push spacebar it never jumps.  :'(CRAFTINGThis game has a ton of crafting.  If you like games where you can spend hours upon hours of just crafting then you will probably enjoy this game.  I myself have already spent the majority of my game time doing nothing but crafting.  The best part is you can master all the crafts the game has to offer, so you will be busy for a while.The game has weapon & armor smithing, cooking, leatherwork, jewelcraft, alchemy, tailoring, etc.  Every craft has it's own gathering profession. All of which are available to master.CLASSESThis game utilizes a custom class system.  In short, you are what you want to be.  And I don't mean you are what you want within the games limits.  You are what you really want.  If you want to be a Battlemage in heavy plate you can do that.  If you want to be an archer with a big 2h weapon you can do that too.  This game's class system is possibly one of the coolest in any MMO I've played.You earn points each level & you can put those points into Health, Mana, Melee, Range, Magic, & Crit/Accuraccy,  It's very easy to build a pure style or hybrid class.  If you plan on trying to do all 3 rolls you may have a harder time.  All equipment also increases these stats varying depending on what type of equipment you use.  There are also 6 Talent Trees.  Templar(Shield), Warrior (2H), Assassin (Dual Wield), Ranger, Mage & Prophet (Heals).  These trees each specialize in a specific weapon or spell type & gives passive/active abilities depending on which weapon/armor/spells you plan on using. The best part about this game's class system is how you go about learning spells/abilities.  You simply buy a scroll from a trainer & learn it.  You keep the ability you purchase forever as well.  Respecs are just for points & talents.  The more powerful spells for each class are in the talent trees which you have to unlock by putting in points.  OVERALLIt's got a great oldschool vibe with a mix of modern day elements & manages to also do some things other games haven't done before.  If you're aching for an old school RPG or MMO experience without the subscription then you should check this one out.  I would recommend downloading the game client outside of STEAM, though.  I was having some wierd bugs running the steam version & all of that went away when I used the install from their official website.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2016
												I Really Like The Game!!! Thumbs Up For Sure, I Like All RPG Magic Games But This One Stands Out Its One OF The FIrst RPG's I've Played On Steam. For People WHo Haven't Gotten The Game Yet YOU SHOULD! I Really Like The Statistics With Leveling Up And How You Can Choose Alot Of Classses, I Also Really Like The Different Skills, Gives Me Something To Do When Im On My Way To The Next Quest (Fishing, Farming, Crystal Cutting, Foresting, Mining, Etc.).There Are A Few Things I Wouldn't Recomend This Game For. One Being Multyplayer, When I Play In A Group In Dungeons And On Quests Sometimes It Messes Up My Quest Goals And I Can Never Finish The Quest, (Like When The Quest Is To Kill Someone And Someone In Your Group Kills Them It Bugs Out And YOUR Goal Is Still To Kill The Guy That Your Partner Killed Making Some Quests Impossible To Finish). Two Being That There Is A SERIOUS Graphics And Lighting Glitch, I've Been Fooling Around WIth he Settings And Nothing Works So Please Eldevin Creators If Your Reading My Review PLEASE Fix This Because It Is One Of The Things That Makes Me Wanna Stop Playing.Thanks For Reading My Review And Remember That The Stuff I Meantoned Isn't All To Eldevin There's Alot To It And Its A Time Consuming Game. Overall Out Of 10 I'd Rate It A 8 If They Fixed The Lighting It Would Be Like A 9.5 xD<SPOILERS>A Few Things I Recommend Not Doing In This Game Is Exploring To Far Early On Because It Will Anoy You Later I Did It When I Was Level 6 And I Should Of Been Doing My Basic Quests But Instead I Went Into Eledevin West And It Was Very Anoying To Get Out Because It Was A Level 10+ Area, So To Make The Long Story Short It Took Me What Felt Like FOREVER To Get Out Of There But Eventualy I Did And I Learnt My Lesson. My Secound Thing I Recommend Is To Go On And Hour Long Skill Grind Because Stuff Like Foraging And Cooking And Mining Is Very Useful In The Future To Make Stuff To Heal You And Get Armour. My FInal Recomendation Is To Start Right Away With Doing The Main Quests Until YOu Finish Advanced Training For All Of The Different Groups In Eldevin Because You Can Get Some Useful Knowledge Off Of Those Quests That Helps Alot With The Little Quests!Review Will Be Edited As The Game Gets Updates!  Thx :)!

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												If there were a sideways thumb, I would have given it here. I'm really just unsure about this game, I do want to say that if your looking for a classic runescape feel. This is it. I'm sure it's been said many times also. I played this game hard, I went on a binge for two days. It's addicting. I thought the game was new, but it's been out for a year. At launch, a year ago, apparently it was very buggy, but of course it would be. I just feel. for a steam launch, they should have cleaned the slate. The game is basic in terms of gameplay, which can be a good thing, however you can bow kite the hard stuff or tab target grind quite easily. I have heard bad rumors. 80% of players are bots. Crazy grind later on and for crafting. Currency is store gems, everyone uses this to trade items. You can just buy the gems and get all the gear you need. For pvp, i have not tried it. But I can assume ranged wins. I hear there aren't much for group dungeons. It is quite story diven, which means plenty of solo play. During my time, I feel that there were too many quests and not enough actuall slaying things. Give us spots to make a group and claim a goblin camp. Dungeons are instanced. It's not exactly freeform like runescape, i got fed up with city quests and went into the sewers, though I needed to do a chain of quests apparently and that's when I stopped playing. This game is still in beta, so a lot of good change is to come. Make a fresh server for steam bro's. Make a ruthless pvp server for the hardcores. (hey p1999 folks) Add in a jump or dodge skill, skillcap for this game is extremly low. Give us interesting classes, monk/necro/enchanter. I'd be fine paying 20 bucks at the front for a non free to play game. So, it's worth playing for a couple of hours, I dunno if you'd wanna go deep into the game.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												I decided to try this game since it was free and my ultimate feedback is this: the game is tedious. Like many MMORPGs, there's a lot of work the game wants you to do rather than actually play. COMBAT: Basically WoW. It's basically pressing buttons. Not much depth at least in the early going when first impressions are made. That is if auto-attack is off...if it's one, I think the game kinda plays for you. I actually wasn't sure what was happening when it was on: my skills kept activating. Anyways, you'll get levels like "kill X of this kind of bad guy" and it's all very typical. CRAFTING: You can basically craft a lot. I don't know how the "player economy" works or if there even is one but this is where a lot of the tedious works come in. I got a quest from the armorsmith to make a copper belt. Fine. I have to not only collect cooper which I can live with even. What I couldn't? Having to walk ALL THE WAY BACK TO WHERE I first "learned" how to make copper in order to mine it and then walk ALL THE WAY BACK. You know what I hate? Having to walk back and forth to places to basically run errans that the game sends me on.It's true I only played two hours but it felt like a lot longer simply because of how much of the game's content is basically just sending you places and back. As for the store, well if you subscribe you get extra XP gain and such so if it's not pay-to-win then it's pretty close.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Planned to play about 20min to check out the game before work... played for 2 hours instead and was late to work.  Highly recommend this game!I did play a little bit of Runescape and even though I loved all the crafting in it, Runescape just seemed slow to me. Hard to explain exactly but I just couldnt stay in Runescape for long. Eldevin in a sense is a lot like RUnescape but it has that "thing" thats keeping me interested. Story Line is pretty cool so far and even though im 2 hours into the game I still havent left the new player town because there is just so much to do and learn!!I love the fact I can use WSAD to walk around instead of mouse clicking, which drives me nuts in games that only have that as its way to move around (Runescape). I am Ultimately a "Crafter MMO Player" because I only play MMOs for the Professions/Crafting aspects of it. I love Crafting in any game and I dont care what guild im in, ill farm out whatever the guild wants because thats what I enjoy doing. From FIshing/Cooking/Forestry/Mining pretty much anything you can think of you can pretty much do in Edlevin and I love doing it in this game. content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												So far I'm blown away. I love the Fable style use what you want to be good at system, also reminiscent of the Amalur game as well. Choosing between a path in Magic, or Melee and Archery or a mix of both. I have yet to get too deep into this game but it looks as though the character advancement is right up my alley being level based but with a lot of choices in allocating your stats and learning new spells and skills. I am interested to get into the crafting system and to see how my character progresses down the Sorcery line. It has a very sandbox feel, but with guided quests so you have an easy start to the game. The tutorial was well done and I even enjoyed reading the quest text. I'm hoping that this game holds it's charm as I continue to play. I recommend trying it, as it's free and feels a lot like older style MMOs specifically Asheron's Call mixed with a modern day MMO feel. See you in Eldevin!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												Totally rewriting my review.I don't know how, but this game is actually becoming quite fun.I can see how it might shoehorn me into a pretty specific build later on, but so far I have had success going glass cannon crit mage. So ~22 hours in and I can say that, although its very rough around the edges, once you find your way around Eldevin it becomes quite a joy to play.  I still haven't met anyone who I didn't like, so they are attracting the right community somehow so far.  I have two characters who are completely different, and I have barely scratched the surface of what Eldevin has to offer in terms of character building.I would have to say that there is a certain 3-way split in Eldevin's Talent tree that I have noticed:Templars, Warriors, and Assassins have beneficial talents which cross over reasonable due to them all being based on melee damage.Rangers are sorta stuck as a pure ranged class unless they really find a way to minmax there way out of a damage loss they will ultimately incur by going hybrid.  Mages/healers are pretty much the most capable of sharing parts of their talent trees due to the nature of healing being based on the same stat as magic damage "Sorcery".As for crafting...its a bit tedious, but its tedious in most games like this.  I will say that you can definitely gather enough resources to go afk crafting for a good half hour at least if you do it right.  Best part about that is you gain xp the whole time.  The balance of costs of materials and such is very tight.  You wont have spare money early on unless you really try very hard to earn it.  I enjoy the challenge, because there is some planning expected of the player here.Dungeons seem a bit easy when you have a full 5-man group, although they can be rough if you are all underleveled and utterly clueless as to how to use your character.All in all I still recommend this game as a 'try me out' mmo.  It's free, after all.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												If you're expecting something like Runescape, you're in the wrong place.It tries to copy some ideas from RS, but utterly fails to deliver any of it the way Runescape does, and in the end only looks similar on the surface. Eldevin is just like any other generic MMO. You fight monsters to level up, assign skill points to whatever class you want to play, buy/learn new attack skills, and then move to a higher level area to repeat the process.The map is clearly separated to sections for different character levels. As you move further from the main city, enemy levels increase and collectable resources change colors. You character level completely locks you away from certain places, because you'll be killed instantly by the high level monsters and you can't harvest any of the resouces at all. There's no low level stuff in high level areas, you can't even unlock new dragon travel paths unless you're high level enough, so good luck walking all the way back home because of this completely arbitrary limitation. For comparison, Runescape allows you to roughly do anything anywhere. No matter where you go, you're bound to find some normal trees and low level ores and enemies, different places mostly change in theme and type of content. Hell, you'll find level 60 trees next to your original spawn and level 70 ores 1 minute walk from there in Runescape, if you want to find something you need to actually find it, not go to any random high level area.Quests are largely "kill X of monster Y" and "collect Z from N", or "talk to this guy on the other side of the map and then come back". There's no character dialogue to make it interesting to read, so you'll be reading walls of text if you want to know what's going on. Rewards are coins and some generic items that may or may not go straight to a shop sell window. Not even worth comparison to Runescape quests.Some skills are sort of fun to train for the first hour or less, but then it starts to become a repetitive grind and you start to ask yourself why you're doing it again, especially because all the rewards are just the same thing with higher numbers attached to them and a higher character level requirement to use. No, you can't eat that bread unless you're level 47.Almost all crafted items look identical to one another, not to mention absolutely hideous. But you don't learn to craft anything new besides a very slight remodel of the same thing anyway.I was playing a mage, and combat was literally just clicking an enemy and then tapping the fire spell skill until the enemy died. There's a bit of variation in the skills, but the fire spell was the only one that was worth using.I keep coming back hoping that it's not as bad as I remembered, but it doesn't take 2 minutes to remember that my path is already laid out for me, there isn't a whole lot of options or variety when you want to do something.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												You know what? I'm enjoying this game. It has a Runescape feel without being all "Buy. Stuff. Buy iiiiiiiit!". You can be a Premium Member and get cool perks but you can also just do it the old-fashioned, free way and get a very similar experience. It's a quaint game with basic graphics (focusing in on my character's face never fails to elicit a shudder) and my laptop makes the framerate sporadic, but it's a nice time waster. My only gripe is that I wish that the map could expand to include all of my objectives, since with that feature not being there I find myself running all over the place to find someone who may need a quest completed or a place to turn a finished quest in.I recommend it if you want a basic MMO RPG to mess around in without being required to buy everything to get ahead.

												For those who are looking for a mix of RuneScape and WoW, then this game is for you. I played RuneScape ever since the release of the game, and I had only played WoW about 3 years so I can say this game relates quite a bit to both of the games. The game is free, however you do have the option to pay a little more to 'support' the game for some nice benefits. As far as graphics, they aren't that bad to say the least compared to the 'Old School RuneScape' graphics. However, they aren't as great as World of Warcraft's graphics. The gameplay is very fun and adventurous, and I haven't really encountered a lot of immaturity on here as I have on WoW and RuneScape. The community doesn't seem too big, but it is pretty big for a small game. I would definitely recommend downloading this game. Give it about 20 or 30 minutes of gameplay and I'm sure you'll like it.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												Ordered a meal in a fine restaurant and pub located in the heart of the kingdom.The service was great. Very polite and prompt. Not to mention some pretty cute servers.It was super expensive, though, so I decided to go with the Loaf of  Bread for 80 copper.After a few moments I can see the waitress coming with a steaming platter.As she comes over the platter vanishes in an instant. There is nothing infront of me at the table. As she leaves I notice my loaf in my backpack. Some kind of joke? No one is laughing, though. I decide to at least quickly eat my meal and leave this awkward establishment. I find myself forced to eat sitting under my chair indefinitely for some reason as I take a bite. Something is very wrong here. I abandon the meal, pay and hit the bar. Chugging 3 of their only drinks in less than a minute I lose consciousness and hit the floor hard. I wake up a few seconds later and find myself to be completely sober. Wicked stuff, cheap too. No one seems to mind. 10/10 would dine again.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												So after seeing the good reviews on this, I thought I'd give it a go.First thing I noticed which is that controls are kinda bugged. Meaning you can't turn the camera angle and walk/strife at the same time. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Solution: I zoomed all the way outy and treated it like an isometric view game.I like the "class" system in this, based on weapons and stats. So I assume you could go half'n'half shield'n'board or healer and a DPS class. It would mean you're not doing as good DPS as the rest on your level though.The questing system won't allow you to go further into dungeons unless you have the quest for it. BUT even that failed, I killed the Hobgoblin, THEN for the quest to kill him, and had to do it again.Graphics are really dated, the screenshots on the storepage are very colorful and hides the bad texturing. But bad texturing is bad texturing. It's really dated. Very bad options for both video and sound.I'd tell you to go try Villagers and Heroes instead, it's better than this, but only marginal..

number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												I really wanted to like this game, how ever it has far too many negative features that just plain turn me off from playing it.Starting with it taking minutes to check if it needs an update, no idea what they are trying to do but it takes much to long just to check if its current version number is not up to date.Run, as fast as you can away from any higher level quests, if you have not done lower level quests first. You will not be able to proceed through the game until you do the lower level quests. I got stuck and almost gave up, but went back and did the lower level quests, then discovered that the part I was stuck at was now working.The murky depths quest is one of these quests that is impossible to complete, and higher level areas keep literally pushing you back towards that area, saying you have to complete it first.One major problem with the game is its constant insistence to flip the camera angle on you to some random point of view. Every time you go to move, you have to readjust the camera so see what you are doing, very annoying. 99% of the time this can be solved by holding the RMB, but sometimes you forget. Whilst on rotation of the screen, once the mouse reaches the side of the screen, rotation stops, even though the mouse is still moving, another annoyance.Another problem is turning off the mouse, what possible reason would there be for that. My char just got killed and I had to click on a button on a pop up window to get resurrected, how do you click on it when you don't know where the mouse is. Next problem is the severe lack of storage space!Everything stacks in such small quantities, some as small as 5, just plain crazy because if fills up your backpack too fast to be enjoyable having to sell stuff that you may need sooner or later!You can apparently buy sacks and bags etc for real money, but I don't have any of that so will most likely not bother playing it much more simply because you have to constantly sell stuff that you may need, if they would just let you stack things in much larger multiples!Combat is crap, don't bother trying to move when fighting, it instantly stops fighting. And no dodge what so ever. Stand toe to toe to what ever your fighting and pray that what ever is close by does not decide to join the fight. Even non hostile monsters will occasionally decide that your hurting one of their buddies and then they all gang up on you, end result being a dead character.Crafting is painful, low level stuff requiring on average 10 of an item to craft some thing. So, you get to craft maybe 10 items tops, before having to run back and gather more of what ever resource you were using to craft with. Wonder if it gets better or worse at higher levels.Yet another problem is your gear keeps wearing out and you have to constantly run back to the local smith to get it repaired.Good luck if you decide to play it, but not for me :(

Becuse its small and all the players there are max lvl of 45 (we'll get back to that) its hard to get a hand with anything. I never got any good feedback form HC except for the one time they thanked me for posting the correct link to a safe mode after a big update that cause lagged. As a player I shouldn't have to correct or do their job for them. If you played the game before steam and wanted to switch to steam you have to do so threw HC as HC did not add a prompt to alert you that you need to transfer an old accout threw them and not via steam and you'll be stuck with a lvl 0 account via steam.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 19, 2015
												Let me make this a quick review. When i first started this game, I felt liek playing RuneScape classic. And I Loved it! The huge world, full of secrets, Great Crafting systems, a lot to do, a lot to waste your time and money on. There are some small Issues, like the horrible scaling in PvP (you still get wrecked 2hit by higher Characters) and the Community is fairly small, but the GAME as a product is great. However...Talking about the community - well, it's fairly small, like I said, and this would be no big Problem. It could be a nice family-like community there. But there is a major Problem with it. Like getting in a new class at a new school, if you start there, there will be already formed cliques and groups. And dare you complain about anything or get beef with a player. The community will unite against you and start insulting and trolling with a rating 11/10 in the world chat. So you have 3 Choices:1. You keep your mouth shut untill you reach max level2. You yust say yes to everythign anyone else sais3. You get into an argument which will lead to mass hatered. YOur name will be remembered in this small community and you can forget any type of Group content.To conclude: This GAME is awesome. Tons of fun, tons of stuff to do. If you have Friends you can play with - do it. It's the best RS-like MMO you can get for free (and I mean FREE), as long as you avoid the community. The community itself ruins the whole game for me.

number of helpful: 5 of 17 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												I came...  I saw...  I quit.The biggest issue with this game is the play control.  Using WASD and the mouse like most every MMO player out there is NOT what this game wants you to do.  Yes, is says to do so at the very beginning of the tutorial, but the game jerks you around when you right click the mouse to move, and once you're in a confined space (goblin cave will be the first time this happens bad) your character will run in slow motion for absolutely no...  ♥♥♥♥ing...  reason.  You can click to move just fine!  But I personally despise MMORPGs that require you to do that.  Awful graphics aside, terrible character animation aside...  the controls are what kill this game.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												First of all, when you open the game, it isn't automatically in fullscreen. You have to manually put it into fullscreen. Who isn't going to do that? That♥♥♥♥♥♥just bothers me.Second, the graphics are painfully ugly. Vanilla WoW looks way better than this, and it came out ten years ago. Yeah, I know it's an indie game, but the graphics shouldn't look like they were ripped straight from an N64 game. Someone pointed out that my point this point was invalid. I'm not one to normally gripe about graphics, but this is 2014. It should not be acceptable to release a game that looks like this when there is technology to make it look better.Character creation was far to minimal. No different races, no different factions, just humans with a few different skins, faces, and hairstyles. If I'm going to be potentially playing with hundreds of other people at once, I want a bit more cosmetic differences in our characters.Then the gameplay. It is nothing you aren't going to find in better MMOs. It was advertized that you didn't have classes, and instead selecting random skills to level. That could have been awesome, but the game wasn't good enough after the first quest to make me want to continue, and explore this.The second I encuntered other players, we all began to talk about how terrible this was.I did not want to play this for longer than I did, because it just wasn't interesting.

												Lovely scenery, fun quests and being self sufficient. This game is great with or withour friends. There is so much to do it is hard to get bored. It's like the updated version of old runescape but a little bit better. I know this game is in the process of adding more things and they are actually on top of that. They just added a guild feature which is great and everything else id fun. When I don't feel like questing I can cook and mine. The quests are fun not too repetitive at all. I whought it might be a p2w but I was wrong which is good. In the store you can main but some boosts or cosmetics which keeps it fair. Overall I really like this game and you should give it a try. :D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												Me and a few of my friends picked this up at the same time as a game to all play together. It's free, has quests and dungeons that you can do together, and we had a lot of fun talking♥♥♥♥♥♥to other players who tried to mine our nodes while we were farming. After a while though xp gain slowed dramatically and it finally became impossible to find space in our inventory and bank between quest items, loot, and profession materials. It became very clear that Hunted Cow wanted us to subscribe for extra xp gain and larger bags. I pay money for content, not the ability to hold more items or aquire adequate amounts of xp so as to avoid running out of questing zones and being forced to grind the same dungeon over and over until the next one opens up. However, I give this game a thumbs up because the time we had playing it was legendary and we reference it quite often, and the fun and funny memories make us laugh.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
												Great music, vibrant world and lovely, nostalgia inducing graphics. You create your own class as you play the game, instead of being forced to choose a class you know nothing about before you've even entered the game world. Crafting is fun to learn and doesn't feel like a useless afterthought. The structure of the world is similar to runescape - instead of wide, empty fields forcing you to spend half your time running, you start in a compact zone full buildings to enter, items you can collect, npcs to give you tasks and monsters to fight. This game feels like a cross between old school runescape and old school WoW. I just started but I can already tell I will love it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												I have to say I enjoyed my time with this game.  However, the dungeons, crafting, and  some quests drive me crazy. Dungeons, well if you are an uber damage type, I guess no problem. but if you decide to be a support type, the mobs spawn faster then you can kill them. To be it is not a challenge, just a stupid pain.  Crafting, if you want to make armor, gather, or prospect  going to TA is insane, People haul away thousands of mats all the time. Make leather or cloth armor, sorry you are screwed with a farming/crafting model that totally sucks. Most quests are a great story, then you run into the "get me 10 bear claw" types. Seems like 2/3 of the bears do not have claws. Gee, if you want me to kill 40 darn bears, let me know from the get go. To be fair, they have created a browser based game that is fun, but clearly is designed for a community a whole lot bigger then what is normally online.

												We finally have a real RPG.Really great experience for anyone even new to mmorpgs, simple and full of amazing content.So much potential and I believe in this very promising game.Pros:- Purely free, with no restrictions or limitations (only gold cap, no big deal)- Plenty of very rewarding quests- Decent map- Professions are very huge, perfect and easy.- Cool walking animation- Very fair gear- Rich skills talent treeCons:- Very poor textures and graphics- Can't swim- Can't jump- Need improved battle keybindings, and better targetting. (Character stops attacking when I move)- Lack of Story (Very boring at some point, too much to read)

content:
Posted: September 9, 2015
												There are few MMOs these days that give you that undescribable feeling of MMOness. Since quitting WoW I've tried just about every MMO that's around, and haven't found anything that's given me a similar feeling of enjoyment and interest.That is, until I tried Eldevin. Although the graphics and music seem dated, Eldevin creates a strong sense of life to the world.One of the main problems I've found is that it lacks a large player base: often it feels like you're alone in the world unless using global chat.It is fairly similar to Runescape in its crafting, which is incredible. Very enjoyable.
